ipl::CText Class Reference

CText is a simple text class to hold information on operations performed on images, last updated 11/2/1999. More...

#include <ipl98/cpp/text.h>

List of all members.

Public Methods

  • CText ()
    The default constructor creates an internal version of m_pHistory and sets m_InternalTIplText to true.

  • CText (TIplText *pHistory)
    Constructor, initializes the member m_pHistory pointer to point to the "History"-variable in the TImage structure.

  • ~CText ()
    The destructor only deletes the contents of m_pHistory if it is an internal created variable (done by checking the m_InternalTHistory attribute), ie.

  • CText & operator= (const CText &SourceHistory)
    overloading of assignment operator, deletes old history in destination

  • bool SetTextPtr (TIplText *pHistory)
    Sets the m_pHistory attribute to point to the given pointer pHistory.

  • TIplText * GetTextPtr () const
    Returns the pointer to the history data.

  • bool Append (const string &str)
    Appends a new string to the text list.

  • bool AppendIPL (const string &str)
    Same as Append() except a text containing "IPL98 version xxx performed", where xxx is the current version of IPL98, is put in front of the text conatined in the parameter str.

  • bool AppendIPL (const char *pCharArray)
    Same as AppendIPL(const string& str) except the given string parameter is now a char*.

  • bool AppendCPArguments (int argc, const char **argv)
    Appends a command promt argument list to the text list.

  • bool Find (const string &str, string &Result)
    Finds first entry in the list containing the text given in str, the whole line is returned in Result.

  • bool FindNext (string &Result)
    Finds the next entry in the list containing the text given by a previous call to Find().

  • bool GetItem (unsigned long Index, string &Result) const
    Gets a string item in the vector at given index.

  • unsigned long TotalItems () const
    Gets the number of string items in the list.

  • bool AddTime (bool Value)
    Disables or enables the automatic adding of time stamps.

  • bool AddDate (bool Value)
    Disables or enables the automatic adding of date stamps.

  • void Empty ()
    Removes all items leaving only one line containing information on how many lines (calls to methods) were deleted.

  • bool Load (const char *pFileName)
    Loads history file.

  • bool Save (const char *pFileName=NULL)
    Saves the history list to a file.

  • bool SetFileInfoFromPathFile (const char *pPathAndFileName)
    Sets the file information for the CText object from a given path and file name.

  • void PrintData ()
    Prints the strings in the list to standard out.

  • void ListToCharArray (char **ppHistory) const
    Converts entire list of strings to one "char*" array.

  • void CharArrayToList (const char *pHistory)
    Converts a "char*" array to one list of strings.

  • bool RemoveLastLine ()
    Removes last line from the history, for internal use only.

  • void AppendCText (const CText &Source)
    Appends one text to this object, for internal use only.

Friends

streaming operators
  • ostream & operator<< (ostream &s, CText &Txt)
    writes all the image information to stream

Detailed Description

CText is a simple text class to hold information on operations performed on images, last updated 11/2/1999.

The CImage and CByteImage classes have an attribute of this type to store information about which methods have been used on the image. It is possible to search this history list for previous calls by the methods Find() and FindNext(). Items cannot be removed, but a call to Empty() will remove all items leaving only one line containing information on how many lines (calls to methods) were deleted. All strings appended to the list will be appended with a date and time stamp. These stamps can be turned off by calling NoTime() and NoDate(). All lines inserted will also be appended a '#' character at the front and a '
' at the end. Methods can only insert single lines, that is lines without the '
' character.

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
1.10, by edr@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen

Definition at line 50 of file text.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ipl::CText::CText (  TIplText *    pHistory ) 
 

Constructor, initializes the member m_pHistory pointer to point to the "History"-variable in the TImage structure.

Sets m_InternalTIplText to false; The destructor does not delete the structure pointed to by m_pHistory, this should be done when the TImage structure which contains the TIplText structure is destroyed.

void ipl::CText::CharArrayToList (  const char *    pHistory ) 
 

Converts a "char*" array to one list of strings.

Needed when calling the Load method on an image. The Load method calls the ANSI C function k_Load(), which cannot handle the C++ strings and lists!

Parameters:
pHistory  The "char*" array to be inserted into this class

bool ipl::CText::Find (  const string &    str,
string &    Result
) 
 

Finds first entry in the list containing the text given in str, the whole line is returned in Result.

The search string is copied to an internal attribute to be used by the method FindNext().

Parameters:
str  The text to search for
Result  The found string, unchanged if not found
Returns :
False if not found

Definition at line 145 of file text.cpp.

References TString::pChars.

bool ipl::CText::FindNext (  string &    Result ) 
 

Finds the next entry in the list containing the text given by a previous call to Find().

Only one occurence in each line is found, i.e. a line can only be returned in Result one time.

Parameters:
Result  The found string, unchanged if not found
Returns :
False if not found

Definition at line 294 of file text.cpp.

bool ipl::CText::Load (  const char *    pFileName ) 
 

Loads history file.

Must be the same format as normal representation. old history is deleted before loading.

Parameters:
pFileName  Name of file including extension and relative or absolute path, f.ex. absolut path "c:/temp/history.txt", relative "history.txt". Both slash ("/") and back slash ("\") can be used in the path. There is no differense between upper and lower case characters, they are treated equally.
Returns :
false if load failed

bool ipl::CText::Save (  const char *    pFileName = NULL ) 
 

Saves the history list to a file.

The history list is always saved inside a PGM file.

Parameters:
pFileName  Name of file including extension and relative or absolute path, f.ex. absolut path "c:/temp/history.txt", relative "history.txt". If no string is given, the file will be saved with the filename set in the member variable m_FileInfo. If this class is an object in the CStdImage class, the m_FileInfo will be set to the same value as the CStdImage fileinfo (contained in the m_Image member), except that the file extension is "txt". Both slash ("/") and back slash ("\") can be used in the path. There is no differense between upper and lower case characters, they are treated equally.
Returns :
false, if both pFileName and the m_FileInfo are NULL.
